bill_title: revise the membership of the Board of Dentistry.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the membership of the Board of Dentistry. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-6A-1 be amended to read as follows: 36-6A-1. The state Board of Dentistry shall consist of seven nine members. Five members shall be dentists in active practice in South Dakota for at least five years immediately preceding appointment. One member shall be a lay person and a resident of this state at least five years. One member Two members shall be a dental hygienist hygienists in active practice in South Dakota at least five years. One member shall be a dental assistant in active practice in South Dakota at least five years. Section 2. That § 36-6A-2 be amended to read as follows: 36-6A-2. Any appointment for a full term under § 36-6A-1 or any appointment to fill any vacancy among the professional members on the Board of Dentistry shall be made by the Governor. A list of dentists and , dental hygienists , and dental assistants recommended by the South Dakota State Dental Association and , the South Dakota Dental Hygienists Association , and the South Dakota Dental Assistants Association , respectively, shall be furnished to the Governor at least ninety days prior to the expiration of an applicable term, or, in cases the case of vacancies a vacancy , within sixty days after the occurrence of such the vacancy. Such The list shall contain not less than two professional members for each membership to be filled.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
